text: bump. Use case: tracking PPC conversions for users that have scheduled a meeting.
you can track the button click to get to the meetings page
BUT you cant add anything to the actual meetings page itself
HubSpot servers, can we as businesses have access to our own or are they shared?
IE via a control panel or plesk login?
Can anyone point me in the right direction to resolve the issue of https:// not forwarding properly?

I also seem to have the same issue as Cindy, it appears the newest update of google chrome is forcing the URL to go to <https://domain.com> instead of <https://www.domain.com> when a user types in <http://domain.com|domain.com> in the URL bar
<@UHW7A789H> there’s an article here <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/root-domain-not-loading-https>
thanks Jon
When I read that article, it looked like the fix was to use a third party redirection service
but, I wasn’t sure
there’s two alternative solutions but EasyRedir charge at minimum $39/month for one website, and if you have a ton of clients it’s a ton of money..
thanks Jon. I was just on the EasyRedir site.
It looks like that might be the easiest solve….although, I don’t love the $39/month price just to redirect
agreed there has to be a cheaper alternative
is it just Chrome that’s doing that? It’s possible that Chrome is intentionally hiding the subdomain to make the URL appear simple to users and that the URL is set up correctly.
I believe so Matthew
double clicking on the address bar should show the true URL I think
ever since hiding the subdomain all HubSpot sites have been doing that and not pushing the www
i suppose if a root domain redirect was never set up
yeah actually i think that’s what it is, if the non-www forward isn’t set up properly it won’t go through as google is now putting the https:// by default in their URL bar
i believe i read somewhere that they are hiding the subdomain in future versions..
Interesting…I didn’t realize it was only in Chrome
for what it's worth, we use easyredir.  $39 gets you 50 redirections so we are able to use it for all of our hs clients
thanks dennis….I’m going to look into it on Monday
if you can use for 50, that’s not so bad
yep.  we have 20 or so in ours now.  it also makes your client happy that you are taking care of this for them.
kind of like getting a chocolate on your pillow at a hotel
ah I see :+1:, I was confused by this a few days ago and it looks like this feature was recently added to Chrome.
Can I have both?
yeah.  they did it in 2018 as well. the author of the article i read was not a fan of this change.

Hi HS Support, Hi everyone, Paul here I have concern, we are using HS recently and appreciate if anyone knows how we can get the segmentation of visitors, subscribers  and especially the conversions (or potential investors) from our landing page referred by our marketing initiatives/campaign - organic & paid) (network referrals) like FB, TW, IG, and LI postings.

Currently, we have two forms in the landing page - 1 form for sign-up and 2 form for invest. We are interested to know how many investors (conversion)?

Hey guys!
Is there a way to know more about A/B Test for Translated pages?
This forum's post says "On Planning" : <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/A-B-tests-on-translated-pages/idc-p/279682/highlight/true#M37563>
Is there a roadmap somewhere?

*Community Management Note*
We just banned someone for soliciting in DMs :fire:  ... Make sure to ping me if you ever get solicited by someone so we can keep this community free of junk. :slightly_smiling_face::pray:
If you're soliciting for work... stop that shit or you'll be banned too. :cop::slightly_smiling_face:  Have a good day. :man-tipping-hand:

Hey Sebastien! In the case of running A/B or adaptive tests with translated content, we're likely still a few months out from having that functionality in production as we're still relatively early on in fleshing out the details for it.
